snippet: Move could usher in Ikea, Starbucks and Apple.
abstract: Move could usher in Ikea, Starbucks and Apple.
lead_paragraph: A month after political opposition led the Indian government to indefinitely delay a decision to allow foreign retailers like Wal-Mart Stores into the country, policy makers on Tuesday changed a rule that would make it easier for niche foreign chains to set up fully-owned stores here, Vikas Bajaj writes in the New York Times today.

headline.main: Single Brand Retailers Get Green Light
